captions.text: [SOUNDS OF DISTORTED MUSIC, CONVERSATION AND ARGUING]
[HEARTBEAT] [SUSPENSE MUSIC]
[HEART BEATS SLOWER, STOPS]
[KHOURI VO] Trouble comes in many different forms;
different sizes and shapes. It often wears disguises;
takes human form even.
Wears good smelling cologne, designer gear and is
usually good in bed. Yeah.
I was introduced to trouble four years ago.
Hello?
[UNINTELLIGIBLE VOICE ON TELEPHONE]
Oh, my God. I have no clue what I'm wearing for school tomorrow.
I'm trying to look cute for this boy. He's got me so crazy.
I don't know what it is.
[UNINTELLIGIBLE VOICE ON TELEPHONE]
[SONG]
[APPLAUSE]
Let's hear it one more time for Saighe Breethen.
[APPLAUSE]
Beautiful young talent. Isn't she?
[COMMENTS FROM CROWD]
But I have a question.
Are you old enough to be in this club?
How did you get in ere? Where your mama at?
'Cause I'm about t tear your ass up.
You probably was outside and got your ass in the line
and snuck your ass into the club.
Better get out or I'll lock you the hell up.
Get your ass off the stage!
But I'll tell you I'll make a deal with you.
Now you got skills and talent.
So if you promise when you make it big you come back,
girl you can do this. You and me on the road.
Imma take you with me big time.
One more time agai for Saighe Breethen.
[CROWD CHEERS]
How you all doing tonight?
Yes... Can I get a gin and tonic?
What you getting?
Just water.
And you're mixing drinks anyways.
That's ok. We'll see it next time.
We'll have fun. Quit trippin'.
-It's what I'm saying. - What?
-I can't stand this places. - Oh, well...
-You like to dance, don't you. - Yeah, I do.
Of course I like to dance.
Put this away. I got it. I'll pay for it.
-I'll put it on my tab. - You follow me anyway.
Since I made you be here, I'll buy you the water.
...we note it like I don't know what.
And I'm gonna pay this fool by the cash
Imma gonna do it so he let me breathe.
You all ladies know that fool by the cast...
It's so lame in here, girl...
I wish they would start playing.
Hmm hmm...
Girl, look what's going down.
Hmmm, like things may be looking up after all.
Look who just walked into room.
He's cute.
I've never seen them before, have you?
Naw. Never.
Damn, the one on the left, he's fine.
His friend ain't too bad either.
You're right.
Smell that, man?
Smell what?
All that pussy in the air, bro.
Man, if you can smell it, I want no parts of it.
No, man. You know exactly what I'm talking about.
Look at all these available, willing chicks out here, man.
It's like a Chinese buffet.
[JUSTICE O.S.] Hmm... Oh!
See that over there, man?
-How do you know about her? - How do I know?
How do I know?
I know. As a matter of fact I'm getting me some of that.
You know what? Good luck with that.
She looks like one of them girls who don't pay hat bullshit.
Besides, what makes you think she can come and holler at you?
Shit.
Who she gonna come holler at then? You?
Come on Marco. Be serious now.
I'm going to talk to him.
What? Saighe, come on girl.
The man just walked in the room.
Give him a chance to chill for a minute.
I don't think they're from here. Give them a second.
No. Exactly. That's all the more reason
for me to welcome his fine ass to Jacksonville.
- Come on, Saighe. - Watch me work.
Saighe... Saighe!
Oh, oh...
- How you doing? - Wassup, baby?
Nothing. What your name?
I'm Justice and this is my friend Marco.
[SAIGHE O.S.] Hey Marco...
[KHOURI V.O.] That was trouble; the tall and sexy
Saighe was talking to. And just like I knew it,
it took no time for him to fall under her spell.
She had that effect on everyone she met.
[CROWD CHEERS]
I see ya! See ya all hating!
[LAUGHS FROM THE CROWD]
What I'm gonna do is bring about our next indi artist,
Another talented brotha, Mr. Igive!
[KHOURI V.O.] Men never responded that way to me.
I mean I'm not hatin' though. She's my best friend
and I understood exactly why she received the attention
she got, but just once it would be nice to get showered
in attention like that. Man, he was so fine. He smiled at her.
No golds; another plus. I had to get my mind off of him.
He was officially placed in the "hands off" category
because Saighe was interested. The DJ was playing some
pretty good music that night and I loved to dance,
so that's what I did...I got out there and danced!
[RAP]
[PEOPLE CHEER AND APPLAUD]
Oh, girl!
Let me introduce you.
This is Justice.
- Hi, girl... - How you doing?
And his friend, Marco.
- How you doing? - Hi, nice to meet you.
Ya'll this is my best friend, Khouri Baxter.
Wassup, Khouri?
Nice to meet you, guys...
She loves to dance.
I know, right?
Yeah.
You been in a video, right?
No.
You gotta be in a video.
Naw!
Wanna dance?
C'mon, let's dance.
[MUSIC]
[KHOURI V.O.] I remember feeling so nervous. Marco... now he was
real cool, sexy, very fly. But would never be anything more
than a friend. Justice on the other hand. Damn, he had me
thinking all kinds of inappropriate thoughts.
[RAP]
[GUYS LAUGH]
Khouri, they wanna take us to get something to eat.
Hell no. Look at me; my clothes, my hair.
I ain't goin'. No!
Come on, Khouri, please! It'll be fun.
Look, I am really feelin' this dude, and I want to spend
a little more time with him. Please! It'll be fun.
We don't have to stay that long anyway.
I can't eat in front of him anyway; I'm too shy.
Come on, please...
Okay, okay.
- We can go? - Yes.
That's my girl. I love you.
Come on.
[BACKGROUD CONVERSATION IN RESTAURANT]
This restaurant is so cold in here, man.
I know. It's chilly, right?
You sweat like a slave on that dance floor.
No wonder why your ass is so cold.
How you all doing tonight?
Hey, how you doing?
Welcome to Power Pizza. My name is Alba
And I'm gonna be your server.
Can I take your drinks order.
Ahhh, I just wanna some water.
Water?
- Water. - Same.
I'll be right back.
Who's that Saighe is talking to?
Oh, just more of her adoring fans.
I take it you don't like them.
Don't know 'em. They don't like me.
You know what? Black women real complicated.
You're always in constant competition with each other.
I don't understand that.
I agree. But it ain't like you men don't benefit
from that dysfunction.
Girl, save that.
Oh no let's talk about it.
I mean you offered your unsolicited opinion about women.
Doesn't seem too unreasonable for me to mention
that a lot of the reason why Black women don't get along
is because of the manipulation, lies, foolishness
and bullshit you MEN put us through.
Not saying that is an excuse,
but it most definitely is a reality.
Here we go.
Look, Khouri, I don't buy that.
Don't sit here and try to justify how some of ya'll act.
Tripping over some dude and half the time he's a scrub...
Aint got no money, no car, and a buncha damn kids
he ain't paying for. And let's not mention his bad breath.
But ya'll steadily chasing a man like that.
Layin'up with him, having more babies with him,
complaining to your Mama and your friends about him
and putting up with his mess just the same.
But I'm just saying this.
Some men do put women through a lot of bullshit.
But at the same time, a lot of ya'll who claim
you don't like it, sure do have a funny way of showing it.
That's shit. [LAUGHS]
How do you like that?
Touché.
Yu know what? You alright with me.
Most females would be about to slap the black offa me
for what I just said.
Black as you are they'd have to do a whole lotta slapping.
I know, right? Now get yo sexy ass out the way,
a brotha gotta use the faculties.
What? It's facilities. You don't want to wait
till the waitress comes to takeb your order?
Naw girl, now move. I have to go.
Justice knows what I want anyway. Right dude?
Yeah.
You just gonna stand there? Have a seat. Trust me.
He's gonna be a while.
Why you in such a hurry for her to come back?
I mean...
It's just kinda rude that she's over there.
I mean, she's supposed to be over here with you.
You know, you are a very good dancer.
Thank you.
You cold?
Just a little bit.
Give you my jacket?
[RESTAURANT BACKGROUD CONVERSATION]
Is that better?
- Feel good now? - [SAIGHE O.S.] Hey...
Hey, baby.
- Did you order? - No, was gonna order now.
Did everything come out?
[KHOURI V.O.] I wasn't sure what was happening.
Didn't understand what game Justice was playing with me.
The way he looked at me... Oh God, I wanted him.
He smelled so good.
He was driving me crazy. Everything was...
The way he completely ignored me. It didn't make sense.
Didn't make sense at all. I knew he felt something too.
I could tell the way he draped his jacket
across my shoulders...
the way his eyes lingered on mine.
I knew he felt something. He had to.
[DOOR OPENING]
Ooh, girl. Had so much fun tonight.
Did you?
I mean, there was a lot of people there.
And you know...
Khouri, you been real quiet tonight? You alright?
What's wrong with you? What's up?
So... What did you think about Marco?
What do you mean 'What did I think about Marco?'
Come on, girl. I saw how he was looking at you.
Ya'll look so cute together. And he is so funny.
And he is so chocolate.
So, why don't you date him?
What? Now you know I got my eye on Justice.
Oh Khouri, you think he likes me?
I do. He couldn't keep his eyes off of you all evening.
His hands either.
I need to do my scrub tonight.
Me and you, we stay up way too late.
Damn Khouri, you being an ass tonight! No sense of humor.
Wassup with that?
Nothing.
Well, you gonna kick me out, that's cool. Whatever.
But promise me one thing.
Look! No more favors for you. Ok?
Naw, seriously. Promise me you'll give the idea
of you and Marco some consideration.
'Cause he really does seem to like you.
Saighe, he knows nothing about me to like me.
- He just met me tonight. - And?
And I really don't see me and Marco kickin' it like that.
I mean, he is cool. Granted. I mean, but just as a friend.
Khouri...
Saighe. Don't push. Just let it go.
- Alright. I won't push. - Thank you.
Enjoy your scrub. I'm tired as hell. I'm going to sleep.
Good night.
Good night.
[SUSPENE SOUND]
What'd you say little girl?
- You are so selfish. - Shut up.
Shut up...
- Speak up! - 'Cause I am tired of your shit!
[UNINTELLIGIBLE ARGUING]
[BREATHING HEAVILY]
[SENSUAL MUSIC]
He saw me.
[GIGGLES]
Just...!
Justice, what the hell are you doing here?
Saighe said she had to make a run.
She'll be back in an hour.
Why didn't you go with her?
I was tired. I had a long night, but you know that already.
I don't know what you're talking about?
Quit playing games, Khouri. I know what you saw
and I most definitely know what I saw.
Look, ah... I don't get down like that.
Saighe is my best friend.
I'm not trying to hurt her. So, you need to leave.
You know this ain't got nothing to do with Saighe.
Don't you?
Justice...
You need to stop that.
I'm not trying to hurt my friend like that.
We've been close for so long...
And she really does like you, so...
I think you need to back up.
I really think you need to go.
- Saighe... - Just go.
Justice...
[KHOURI V.O.] The more this man touched me, the more I thought
about what I had seen the night before... those lips...
I pleaded for God to take the desire
that was stirring inside of me away.
I wanted to be freed from this hold he had on me but...
I couldn't fight it anymore.
The more I kissed him...
When he got on his knees and lowered his face
into the center of me...
That's how it all began. And now four years later,
Saighe is six months pregnant with his child.
I knew that I was wrong for being involved
with my best friend's man. I knew that.
But hell, you can't help who you fall in love with.
And I was in love; deeply, crazy in love with Justice Evans.
Thanks for meeting me, Khouri.
You're welcome.
Sounded like you have something heavy on your mind.
Actually, I do.
Okay...
What's up?
Look, Khouri. I won't drag this out, ok?
We've been doing that thing for like four years now,
and I ain't gonna lie, I dig being around you.
It's like you bring out that other side of me.
The side the Saighe can't.
I like that. I really do.
Justice, you know how much you mean to me, right?
I know that I shouldn't feel this way about you,
but I can't help it. I love you.
Khouri...
I didn't say it, so you say it back.
I just thought you should know.
I mean, I really do love you.
I wanted to tell you we can't keep doing this.
We just can't. I'm sorry
What? We can't do this any more?
Really? We can't do this anymore. Is that what..
Khouri, stop. Stop. We can't do this.
I don't understand. I just told you I love you,
and the next thing out of your mouth is
you can't do this no more?
Look... Khouri, I never meant to hurt you.
We have to be real with each other.
All we ever had was some good sex.
We knew nothing else was going to come out of this.
We knew it!
Good sex. Nothing more.
Nothing more? Nothing more!?
No, fuck that!
I have been waiting... waiting for you to make a choice.
Waiting for you all this time.
And now you want to do the right thing?
Now all of a sudden because she's pregnant
you want to do right by her.
Four years Justice! I have been waiting for you
for four long years. It was more than just sex to me.
It was more than that.
Lower your voice.
Don't tell me what to do!
I'll talk as loud as I damn please!
I ain't your woman and you can't tell me what to do!
You right! You ain't my woman, and you're never will be.
I'm outta here!
Justice...
Justice!
Justice wait!
Last night, man, it was so mean, man.
I went to So-Hooo!
So-Hooo!
It was hot, man, I'm telling you.
You should've been there.
I'm telling you it was sooo...
So mean. I got two, man.
Man, last night, man...
Hey, girl, you gotta man? Wassup?
Hey, what? You're not gonna answer me?
Wassup?
What? What?!!!
What you gotta say this damn way... what?
Oh, you wanna know if I got a man, right?
- Is that it? - Yeah...
Ok, so let me answer that for you.
Well, first, what if I say I do. Then what?
Well, I ask you for your number so we can conversate.
Oh, ok. Conversate, huh?
Yes.
Did your dumb ass know that's not a word?
It's converse.
So with that being said, why would I waste time
with a regular negro like you,
wearing clothes three sizes too big for him?
Pants sagging showing your dirty drawls.
Hanging around in the middle of the day
with another hard ape which means your ass ain't got no job.
Ain't got no keys and that tells me
Your ass ain't got no car.
Going around you negro with a nap ass hair.
What the hell do you possibly want from me.
Man, leave that hoe alone.
She must have her period or something.
Hoe? My period?
See, that's what's wrong with you boys today.
I don't know who the hell told you it was ok to talk to
and treat a woman like that?
But whoever it is needs to get the ass kicked.
Oh, I'm the hoe because I have no interest in you?
No, I'm on my period because I'm tired of being mistreated
by you all?
Wassup? You ain't got nothing to say now?
Oh, you don't wanna conversate with me no more, huh?
What's the problem, fellas? Come on.
Come on! Come back!
[KHOURI V.O.] I was trippin'. I was taking my frustration
about the situation with Justice out on them.
I was so angry! He made a fool out of me!
A complete a total fool.
[MUSIC]
You're right. You ain't my woman, and you never will be!
[MUSIC]
I wanted to tell you that we can't do this anymore.
We can't see each other anymore. I'm sorry.
[MUSIC]
[WATER RUNNING] [MUSIC]
Justice!
Justice wait!
[MUSIC]
[CRYING]
[UNINTELLIBLE SCREAMING WHILE CRYING]
[KHOURI V.O.] It's been three weeks since I had seen
or talked to him. Three, long, sad weeks.
I thought about the situation all the time.
Him telling me that he wanted
to be with Saighe and his child; that I was just a side job,
someone that fulfilled his fantasies.
Hadn't spoken to Saighe either. Torn between the guilt I felt
for betraying her and that dull ache in my heart
for the man we both loved.
[PHONE RINGS]
Hello?
So I have to call you from a blocked number
in order to speak to you, huh?
Saighe, hey girl.
What's up?
What's up? Why haven't I seen you, Khouri?
Where the hell you been?
Saighe, I have been busy, reaping around. How you doing?
Khouri, you supposed to be my best friend.
You been avoiding my calls, I haven't seen you in weeks.
Why are you acting so weird?
I know. I just have had a lot on my mind.
It's like you're shutting me out or something
and I have no idea why or what I've done
to make you act this way.
Saighe, it has nothing to do with you.
I just been doing some soul searching, that's all.
Hell, you had me worried sick.
So tell me, what's new with the baby?
The baby is fine. Kicking, moving all the time.
And I don't know what it is about being pregnant,
but I am so horny all the time.
And you know how, Justice is.
[LAUGHS]
What?
No, I don't.
I don't know how Justice is. You said I knew
how he was and all I'm saying is I don't.
Um, okay. All I was going to say was that you know
how much he loves to have sex.
Well, since I got pregnant, he wants it all the time.
Okay that's cute. Excuse me while I go throw up.
Oh, please. You just mad you ain't getting it on a regular.
Yea you right.
Well, you know what? That drought is gonna be over.
What do you mean, Saighe?
Justice's cousin recently moved from out of town,
and I'm having a little party for him. I want you to come
Maybe ya'll make that love connection.
Hell naw! I don't do that. You know that I don't do that.
I've old you about that.
Why girl? It ain't like you seeing anybody.
Damn!
Give it a try. I just want to see you happy.
Saighe!
Well, if I can't hook you two up, can at least
you come by and get something to eat?
You coming to the party?
Ok, I'll come... for you.
You wanna catch a movie or something?
No, thanks anyway.
I'm thinking 'bout goin' to the club.
I don't understand how you go out by yourself like that.
I feel like dancing.
Well, be careful. These fools out here
looking for a reason to hurt someone.
Yes, ma'am.
Well I'll talk to you later. I love you, sis.
I love you back.
Bye.
[MUSIC]
It's so quite over here.
[MUSIC]
- Vodka and cranberry. - Sure.
Good crowd here tonight. Ain't it?
Yeh, very good music.
Yeh. I'm new, just got here from Atlanta, so...
I got out to see the social life.
Oh, so you are new?
Yeah...
[SONG]
I saw you dance there...
Yeah?
Yeah, and I thought this would be your nickname.
What?
Dancer
[MUSIC]
I had a really good time with you tonight, Zarion.
[GIGGLES]
You know it's been a while since I don't go out
with a real gentleman, and I need it this, so...
- Hey.. - Thanks.
It's not like the temptation wasn't there.
I enjoyed myself too. I hope I get to see you again.
Can I be honest with you?
Honesty is good.
I just got out of something, and I'm still dealing with it.
It's been kinda rough. Know what I'm saying?
Then I came at the perfect time.
Why is that?
So I can take your mind of whoever was stupid enough
to let you go.
That was sweet.
We can catch a movie, get some coffee,
take a walk in the park. You know, start there.
No pressure.
Like I said, I just... I need to find myself
in a good place. You seem like a really nice guy.
I really don't wanna leave you on a swear...
It's just too much right now.
Ok, well, the offer still stands.
I'm not going anywhere. Pick me up when you're ready
to drop that zero and get with it...
Get with this hero?
[LAUGHS]
Right, you got it. So I guess I'll be seeing you.
Maybe.
- Take care. - You too.
[MUSIC]
[KNOCK ON DOOR]
[DOOR OPENING]
Who is it?
Hi, Justice.
You're moving my heart again. Hi, Sis!
Oh, you look so pretty.
Hey, where's the party at? What's going on?
It's so good to see you.
Hey who's this?
- I'm Selena. - Hey, Selena.
- How are you? - Good. I'm Seighe.
Zarion.
Zarion, come here.
Khouri?
Small world, huh?
I'll say. How you doing?
I'm good. How are you?
Wait up. Ya'll know each other?
Well, we met last night at the club.
Ok.
- Wassup? - You wanna drink something?
Yeah, sure.
So you're Justice's cousin, huh?
Yea, we more like brothers than anything.
Really?
This is so crazy, you know?
Us running into each other again. You knowing my cousin
and his fiancé and all...
Fiance? What are you talking about? They aren't engaged.
Excuse me everyone!
I have an announcement to make.
As you can see, Justice and I are about to have
our first child.
This is such an exciting time in our lives.
Khouri, I love you. You have been my best friend for so long
and we have been through a lot together.
I want you ask you to be the baby's Godmother,
And I want you to stand for me in my wedding.
Justice and I are getting married.
Saighe, I don't know what to say.
Say you'll do it.
There is no one else that I ask, but you.
Just...
Congratulations I guess.
Oh, God!
Khouri!
[LOUD KNOCK ON DOOR]
[ZARION] Khouri, you alright?
No.
Come on, let me in. Let's talk.
Zarion, please go away.
Please let me in. I just want to make sure
that you are okay Dancer, come on.
Sorry.
So ah...
What made you cry like that? Saighe was scared to death.
I told her to let me talk to you.
I don't know. I just really can't.
I guess I don't think I'm worthy of being that baby's Godmother
But why?
I'm just not.
Saighe believes that you're worthy.
Why not step up to the plate?
It's complicated.
[SAIGHE BEHIND DOOR] Khouri? Can I talk to you?
Yes, Saighe. Give me a minute.
I'll be out.
[CLEARS THROAT] Saighe...
Hey.
Hey.
You alright?
Yeah, I'm alright. I guess I needed time alone.
Talk to me and tell me why you ran out of the room in tears?
I'm just emotional right now I guess.
So I take it by your response that
you don't want to be the baby's Godmother?
No, please, it's nothing like that. That's not the situation.
I just... wasn't expecting you to say something like that.
It just caught me off guard. That's all. I'm sorry.
Who else would I consider, Khouri? You're my best friend.
There's no one else I'd even ask that, but you.
Saighe, there are so many people that love and respect you.
And those same people wonder why the hell you are friends
with someone like me. I guess sometimes I do, too.
Khouri, you are a beautiful, talented, loving person.
People don't know that about you because you don't show that.
Maybe that's because of your past, your parents.
I don't know.
But I do know that side of you. And that's why I asked you.
- Saighe... - What?
Saighe...
What's wrong, Khouri?
- I need to tell you something? - What is it, Khouri?
No... I can't take this.
I feel so bad. I wanna tell you.
Khouri, what is it?
What is it? You starting to scare me.
[KHOURI CRIES]
Please, tell me what's wrong with you, Khouri.
[KNOCKING ON DOOR]
JUSTICE: Ya'll alright in there?
Yea, babe. We'll be out in a second.
Just having a girlie moment. It's okay.
Alright.
Let's go back out there. I'm sure Zarion is waiting for you.
He seemed so concerned, and...
He's cute. He is really cute.
Yeah, he is.
He's a good kisser, too.
What? You kissed him?
You know...
Just give him a chance. Don't shut him out, Khouri.
Thanks, girl. Thanks for everything.
[LAUGHING] Come on, get your ass up. I love you.
- I love you, sis. - I love you, too.
Hmmm... I love you so much.
- You're ready? - Let's go.
[KHOURI V.O.] I have to tell her.
As much as I know it will hurt her,
Saighe deserves to know the truth.
I can't believe she asked me to be her baby's Godmother.
Damn, how could I accept such an honor
when I was in love with the child's father?
When I had been sleeping with him, behind her back,
all these years?
Justice!
We already talked. You already told me how you felt.
I don't have time to deal with this shit no more.
What is it that you want to say that you brought your ass
up here, all the way to my house? What is it that you want?
Justice, tell me what...
Get off me! What the hell is wrong with you?
- You and Zarion? - What about me and Zarion?
What do you mean you and Zarion? Just the thought of him
kissing you, touching you, hugging you!
Look, you're mine. I love you. This is mine. Come here!
Get off me!
[SLAP]
[MUSIC]
[HEAVY BREATHIG]
- You miss me? - Yeah, I miss you.
You love me?
I love you.
More than Saighe?
Yeah... more than Saighe.
[SENSUAL MUSIC]
You okay?
Yeah, I'm good. You?
I'm more than okay. I'm amazing.
[LAUGHS]
Oh yeah? Why's that?
Because...
came...
for me.
What do you mean?
I mean... Seeing me with Zarion.
It must have made you realize that you do love me.
That you do want to be with me.
- Justice... - Yeah?
